alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 10:22PM MDT until May 30 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Although flows are expected to remain below flood stage, flows will remain near bankfull conditions. These flows will remain high, swift, and dangerous throughout the upcoming holiday weekend. For the South Fork of the Odgen River...including Huntsville... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Continued high flows remaining near bankfull. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet, low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM MDT Friday the stage was 4.4 feet (854 CFS). - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady just below flood stage through the weekend. - Action stage is 4.4 feet (880 CFS). - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 CFS). &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
